citation.article-title: Nocardia araoensis sp. nov. and Nocardia pneumoniae sp. nov., isolated from patients in Japan
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Nocardia araoensis sp. nov.
Nocardia araoensis (a.ra.o.en′sis. N.L. fem. adj. araoensis referring to Arao city, where the bacterium was isolated).
Aerobic, Gram-positive, partially acid-fast, non-motile actinomycetes that form a branched substrate mycelium that fragments into rod-shaped elements (0·3–0·5×1·0–1·7 μm).
Faint yellow substrate mycelium, and cotton-white to greyish white aerial mycelium.
Colony size is small; dimensions are 0·5–1·4 mm for 7 days at 30 °C on MH II medium with 0·2 % glucose.
Acetate, citrate and glucose are utilized, but adonitol, arabinose, erythritol, galactose, inositol, maltose, mannose, rhamnose, sorbitol, adipic acid, acetamide and gluconate are not.
Adenine, casein, hypoxanthine, tyrosine, xanthine, aesculin, arbutin and elastin are not decomposed.
The DNA G+C content of the type strain is 69 mol%.
The type strain, IFM 0575T (=NBRC 100135T=JCM 12118T=DSM 44729T), was isolated from BAL of a male Japanese patient with non-tuberculosis mycobacterium infection.
